tool.name: Assess Reads Quality
tool.command: mkdir -p ${__tool_directory__}/$$/ && #if $type.single_paired_selector == "single": cat '$readSE' | /home/miniconda2/bin/fastqc -t ${thread} -o ${__tool_directory__}/$$/ stdin:single && mv ${__tool_directory__}/$$/single_fastqc.html $rawFastQC && /home/miniconda2/bin/fastp -w ${thread} -q ${qualified_quality_phred} -l ${length_required} #if $adapter_sequence.adapter_sequence_input == "single": -a '${adapter1}' #end if -i '$readSE' -o ${cleanReads} -h ${__tool_directory__}/$$/fastp.html -j ${__tool_directory__}/$$/fastp.json && cat '$cleanReads' | /home/miniconda2/bin/fastqc -t ${thread} -o ${__tool_directory__}/$$/ stdin:clean_single && mv ${__tool_directory__}/$$/clean_single_fastqc.html $cleanFastQC && rm -rf ${__tool_directory__}/$$/ #else: cat '$readR1' | /home/miniconda2/bin/fastqc -t ${thread} -o ${__tool_directory__}/$$/ stdin:R1 && cat '$readR2' | /home/miniconda2/bin/fastqc -t ${thread} -o ${__tool_directory__}/$$/ stdin:R2 && mv ${__tool_directory__}/$$/R1_fastqc.html $rawFastQC_1 && mv ${__tool_directory__}/$$/R2_fastqc.html $rawFastQC_2 && /home/miniconda2/bin/fastp -w ${thread} -q ${qualified_quality_phred} -l ${length_required} #if $adapter_sequence.adapter_sequence_input == "paired": -a '${adapter1}' -A '${adapter2}' #else: --detect_adapter_for_pe #end if -i '$readR1' -o ${cleanReads_1} -I '$readR2' -O ${cleanReads_2} -h ${__tool_directory__}/$$/fastp.html -j ${__tool_directory__}/$$/fastp.json && cat '$cleanReads_1' | /home/miniconda2/bin/fastqc -t ${thread} -o ${__tool_directory__}/$$/ stdin:clean_R1 && cat '$cleanReads_2' | /home/miniconda2/bin/fastqc -t ${thread} -o ${__tool_directory__}/$$/ stdin:clean_R2 && mv ${__tool_directory__}/$$/clean_R1_fastqc.html $cleanFastQC_1 && mv ${__tool_directory__}/$$/clean_R2_fastqc.html $cleanFastQC_2 && rm -rf ${__tool_directory__}/$$/ #end if

param.name: length_required
param.label: Minimum read length
param.help: Reads shorter than this value will be discarded, default is 15.

param.name: qualified_quality_phred
param.label: The quality value that a base is qualified
param.help: Default 15 means phred quality >=Q15 is qualified.

param.name: thread
param.label: Threads
param.help: The number of threads used for parallel computation.

exit_code.description: Error Running combine collection to a file

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
In this function, two existing NGS tools FastQC (Andrews *et al*., 2010) and fastp (Chen *et al*., 2018) are integrated to check sequencing reads quality and obtain high-quality reads, respectively.
-----
.. class:: infomark
**Inputs**
- **Input FASTQ file:** single-end or paired-end raw epitranscriptome sequence reads in FASTQ format. - **Adapter sequences:** optional, adapter sequences in FASTA format.
-----
.. class:: infomark
**Parameters**
- **Minimum read length:** reads shorter than this value will be discarded, default is 15. (-l) - **The quality value that a base is qualified**
-----
.. class:: infomark
**Outputs**
- **Raw reads fastqc report in HTML format** - **Clean reads in FASTQ format** - **Clean reads fastqc report in HTML format**
